Kayako - ticket id 60078199 // Christian Schmidt commented privately: The problem has existed since we started using MailEssentail.
I will install the new version on Friday. And then I will create the logs etc. again.

The mails in the provider mailbox only exist once, see screenshot. That is not the problem. From the moment MailEssentails retrieves them, they are duplicated. So there is an error in MailEssentails. And because there are not many setting options for the POP3 download. The error must be in the software code during processing.

The Kerio setting for duplicate mail is nice but does not work so that the mals come from MailEssentails to Kerio via relay. So not an option.

Kayako - ticket id 60078199 // Qasim Ali commented publicly: Dear Christian,

Thank you for your patience.

I have reviewed the logs, but unfortunately, I could not find any entries that capture the issue you are experiencing. Based on our findings, it appears this problem is not occurring for other customers using the same version.

To escalate this matter to our development team, we will need the issue to be reproduced on the latest version of MailEssentials (v22). You can find the release information here:
MailEssentials Product Releases [https://gfi.ai/products-and-solutions/network-security-solutions/mailessentials/resources/documentation/product-releases]

To better understand the issue, could you please provide the following information:
Questions:

	* When did the issue start?
	* Are emails in your POP3 mailbox single or already duplicated?
	* Do you have any POP3 logs we can review?
	* Have there been any recent changes on the POP3 side?

Suggestion:
If you are using Kerio Connect, you may disable duplicate messages using the guidance provided here:
Configuring the Drop Duplicate Messages Option [https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/114417-configuring-the-drop-duplicate-messages-option]

Best regards,
Qasim Ali
GFI - MailEssentials Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Kayako - ticket id 60078199 // Qasim Ali commented privately: 	* customer is on 21.8, which is not the latest version since a new version has been released in last week  

 	* https://gfi.ai/products-and-solutions/network-security-solutions/mailessentials/resources/documentation/product-releases 
 	* to escalate and engage development team, we will need them to be on the latest version 

	* last time similar issues occurred, they were bugs 

 	* https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/120264-external-users-sending-to-discussion-list-get-back-multiple-duplicates-of-emails-from-the-list 
 	* https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/116920-imported-items-into-keyword-filtering-are-duplicated 

	* as per my findings from the logs, pop2service is not loading duplicates. There are occurrences of one tmp file 2 to 4 times but there are no the emails otherwise we should see other numbers like 1, 3, 5, or more 

 	* I see that there is a ticket for duplicate emails in the KConnect https://central-supportdesk.kayako.com/agent/conversations/60075820 
 	* and it was suggested to drop duplicate emails as well https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/114417-configuring-the-drop-duplicate-messages-option 

	* when did the issue start? I do not think this is s bug, if this were another customer's would have created tickets, but I do not see tickets from other customers 

 	* are emails in the pop3 single or multiple since GFI provides pop2 which gets emails from the customer's pop3 see https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/119271-troubleshooting-the-gfi-pop2exchange-service 
 	* as per this we need the copies of the emails to see the message id to see the duplicates
 	* can they share their pop3 logs since in current logs for the gfi pop2exchange service we do not see anything for duplicate entries

Kayako - ticket id 60078199 // Christian Schmidt commented privately: Yes, the logs are from later, but that doesn't matter.
Because for EVERY mail that has at least 2 recipients in the same domain, the mails come twice. the logs should be full of examples.

The error is in the internal processing of MailEssentails. I have sent you the mails in msg format. An export in eml did not work in Outlook.

Since no setting is responsible for the problem, the error must be in the software code.

Kayako - ticket id 60078199 // Qasim Ali commented publicly: Dear Christian,

Thank you for sharing the logs and the email sample.

We reviewed the logs, and it appears that they start from June 23rd. However, the email sample you provided (Message-ID: 6172de69-2460-433d-a6fb-3ada0a849d2d@uweelectronic.de) is dated June 16th, and as such, it is not present in the current log set.

To proceed effectively, we kindly ask you to reproduce the issue again (i.e., receive duplicate emails), ensure that tracing is enabled, and then share the updated logs along with a sample .eml file of the duplicated message.

This will help us capture the issue in the logs and perform a detailed analysis.

Best regards,
Qasim Ali
GFI - MailEssentials Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Kayako - ticket id 60078199 // Muhammad Rizwan commented publicly: Dear Christian,

Thank you for your patience.

To help us investigate this further, please provide the following:

1. A sample `.eml` file of a duplicated message exported from an affected mailbox.
2. Confirmation that the message was delivered only once to the POP3 mailbox.
3. A screenshot of your POP3 connector configuration.
4. The ME logs by following the Creating and Submitting Troubleshooting Logs & other relevant info for GFI MailEssentials [https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/118509-creating-and-submitting-troubleshooting-logs-other-relevant-info-for-gfi-mailessentials] article.

We look forward to hearing back from you soon. If you have any questions or concerns, please let us know and we will be happy to address them.

Best regards,
Muhammad Rizwan
GFI - MailEssentials Support Team
